etymology.description: 革(革) (gé, "change") + 月(月) (yuè, "moon") = changes in moonlight -> 雨(雨) (yǔ, "rain") added -> final form 霸
etymology.interpretation: The character 霸 originally depicted the concept of changes occurring with the moon, which connoted authority and dominance. The addition of 雨(雨) (yǔ, "rain") as a phonetic component refined its association with natural influence and dominance.

examples.chinese: 他喜欢称霸武林(他喜歡稱霸武林)。
examples.english: He enjoys dominating the martial arts world.

examples.chinese: 这座建筑设计得十分霸气(這座建築設計得十分霸氣)，引来众人赞叹(引來眾人讚歎)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zuò jiànzhù shèjì dé shífēn bàqì, yǐn lái zhòng rén zàntàn.
examples.english: The building is designed in a strikingly dominant style, attracting widespread admiration.

examples.chinese: 那位霸主(那位霸主)独自统治着边疆(獨自統治著邊疆)。
examples.pinyin: Nà wèi bàzhǔ dúzì tǒngzhì zhe biānjiāng.
examples.english: That overlord rules the border alone.
